Finding Valleys¶

To detect valleys use the following functions.

An example to detect and validate racket valleys¶
    vallyes = findValleys(x)
    vallyes = groupValleys(vallyes)
    #only for racket
    vallyes = checkValleysSanity(vallyes, wall_valleys)
Utils.Valleys.findValleys(dist: array, th_c: float, th_d: float) → array¶

Detect valleys by performing template maching

Parameters:

  • dist – distance between two objects (e.g. racket and wall)

  • th_c – only consider maching score higher than th_c

  • th_d – only consider valley with a height less than

Returns:

index of the valleys

Utils.Valleys.groupValleys(v: array, dist: array, within_th: int = 10, n_group=(1, 4)) → array¶

Valley detection algorithm to finds multiple valley. Group collections of valleys that are very near (within threshold) and we take the min index

Parameters:

  • v – valleys index

  • dist – distance between two objects (e.g. racket and wall)

  • within_th – the within threshold

  • n_group –

Returns:

grouped valleys index

Utils.Valleys.checkValleysSanity(racket_vy: array, wall_vy: array, dis_th=100) → array¶

Check the sanity of the valley. Two racket valleys in different episode must bigger than dis_th. Two racket valleys in the same episode muss have wall valley (a time when the ball hits the wall)

Parameters:

  • racket_vy – Racket valley index

  • wall_vy – Wall valley index

  • dis_th – the minimum distance between two episodes

Returns:

cleaned racket valley index
